solution_line_template: The discount saved when buying from Guitar Center would be ${suggested_retail_price} * {gc_discount_percent_num}% = $<<{suggested_retail_price}*{gc_discount_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={gc_discount_amount}>>{gc_discount_amount}.
The total cost when buying from Guitar Center would be ${suggested_retail_price} - ${gc_discount_amount} discount + ${gc_shipping_fee} shipping = ${gc_total_cost}.

The discount when buying from Sweetwater would be ${suggested_retail_price} * {sw_discount_percent_num}% = $<<{suggested_retail_price}*{sw_discount_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={sw_discount_amount}>>{sw_discount_amount}.

The total cost when buying from Sweetwater would be ${suggested_retail_price} - ${sw_discount_amount} discount + ${sw_shipping_fee} shipping = $<<{suggested_retail_price}-{sw_discount_amount}-{sw_shipping_fee}={sw_total_cost}>>{sw_total_cost}.
Thus, Silvia would save ${gc_total_cost} - ${sw_total_cost} = $<<{gc_total_cost}-{sw_total_cost}={amount_saved}>>{amount_saved} when buying from Sweetwater.
